bibl.title: Letter from Ralph Cooper Hutchison to Philip Showalter Hench, September 16, 1940

div1.p: Hutchison informs Hench that Sun Oil will pay Moran's travel expenses, which will free up Hench's gift for Kissinger.

div1.head: Letter from Ralph Cooper Hutchison to Philip Showalter Hench, September 16, 1940

opener.dateline:
THE PRESIDENT'S OFFICE
WASHINGTON AND JEFFERSON COLLEGE
WASHINGTON, PENNSYLVANIA
September 16, 1940

div1.p:
I managed to see Mr. Pew day before
yesterday and the Sun Oil will be delighted to pay
the expenses and to bring Mr. Moran up here.
As soon as they received my letter on the subject,
they wrote right down to him and made the arrange-
ment. This enables us to use your gift for
Kissinger and we have written to him and invited
him to come. I have a letter in this mail from
General Kean and I will see to it that he is put on
the invitation list for the exercises.

This is just a word of progress.
Give our love to Mary and the children.
div1.closer:
Fraternally yours, Hutch Doctor Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
RCH/M
